title: Salute to Adventurers
author: Buchan, John
snippet: The Promised Land might smile as it pleased, but we were still on theflanks of Pisgah with the Midianites all about us.

title: Salute to Adventurers
author: Buchan, John
snippet: Some day I would enterinto that land of Canaan which now I saw from Pisgah.

title: Essays critical and imaginative,
author: Wilson, John
snippet: Whereas the ingenious young gentleman had to skirt, in long descent, the top of tremendous precipices to the slack called Ash-Course, where he had no more business to be than on the top of Pisgah.

title: Noctes Ambrosianæ.
author: Wilson, John
snippet: Suppose me, sir, surveying the scene, like Moses frae the tap o' Pisgah the Promised Land.

title: Days of the past;
author: Shand, Alexander Innes
snippet: Since then his rare genius has come slowly to be recognised ; after a tantalising and disheartening struggle he has scaled the heights of the literary Pisgah, and had the fortune, in the fulness of years, to descend into the Land of Promise.

title: Art Rambles in the Highlands and Islands of Scotland ... With ... sketches, etc
author: Reid, John T.
snippet: Blest John, for Jesus' sake, in Patmos bound,His prison Bethel, Patmos, Pisgah found ;So the bless'd John, on yonder rock, confined,—His body suffer'd, but no chains could bindHis heaven-aspiring soul: while day by day,As from Mount Pisgah's top he did surveyThe promised land, and view'd the crown by faithLaid up for those who faithful are to death.
